Articles.Content:
Nevermind. I'm just going to stick with conventional propulsion for now.

Also, the MK6 was a bit too large. I want to armor the engines inside the superstructure.

My new version is basically 3 Mk6s sandwitched together, into the length of one half a Mk6. It's wonerful, but it's 253 parts each. My Reed IV carries two of those to get up to 6 m/s.

My new version is basically 3 Mk6s sandwitched together, into the length of one half a Mk6. It's wonerful, but it's 253 parts each. My Reed IV carries two of those to get up to 6 m/s.

The main factor discouraging me from nuclear propulsion at the moment is the large part count. I think I'll just create some new hulls and try to come up with alternate weapons placements.

I already have an idea for a Thales SMART-L radar mount, but I might swap out the illuminator for a sea sparrow launcher battery.

Edited January 25, 2015 by andrew123

SeaShip1 in the house! I decided to join in on this fun by making a ship with a missile on top;

So yea, I guess I'm in. I've got a lot to learn, but I think I can handle it.

EDIT: Whops, forgot to say I already deployed it.

SeaShip1 in the house! I decided to join in on this fun by making a ship with a missile on top;

http://i.imgur.com/WfCgzXK.png

So yea, I guess I'm in. I've got a lot to learn, but I think I can handle it.

EDIT: Whops, forgot to say I already deployed it.

Noot noot, little one.
Am I the only one here completely clueless as to how to build a boat or a tank?

Am I the only one here completely clueless as to how to build a boat or a tank?

For a boat: Build a spine, then a hull around that spine. Above the spine, put superstructure, weapons, etc.

For tank: Build chassis, wheels, then start putting armor on top of it. Attach weapons to top.

For tank: Build chassis, wheels, then start putting armor on top of it. Attach weapons to top.

Or sides, inside, back, front, whatever other crazy angles you can think of.

The top is too vulnerable.

...

I just gave myself a brilliant idea!

Or sides, inside, back, front, whatever other crazy angles you can think of.

The top is too vulnerable.

...

I just gave myself a brilliant idea!

That's why my warships are so huge - they're designed to stay afloat.
Alright. I'm trying out some enlarged superstructure and low drag hull designs. The Smart L and sea sparrow are going to be installed soon.

CAN SOMEONE BATTLE ME PLEASE ANYONE... im lonley ._.

CMON PLEASE ANYONE ZEKES SPARTWO SCRIPTKITTEH I KNOW U GUYS HAVE TANKS ._.

Two turreted Panthers have been sighted near the KSC. Destroy them at all costs.

Limit of One craft if you are going first (make sure you have enough ammo) Or two craft if you go second.

(I tried to get in more tanks but the damn save wouldn't let me quicksave or even leave the game if I did)

http://www./download/05xbkz2btu4a5so/persistent.sfs

Limit of 40 tons. No more than two vehicles will participate. (Take only one if you choose to go first, or expend all ammunition on the first attack you make)

all right, I'll do it.

And, around an hour after I made the original...

SeaShip2!

There are 2 seats; one in the cockpit, and one in a mk 1 lander can in that box. "The box" also contains a ton of monoprop. It fuels about 27 linear rcs thrusters to go foreward in the sea. And, to get there, I use the wheels. Also, I decouple them once in the ocean. Last but not least, might as well tell you the pilots; Bill and DunDun.

Dunnn!

EDIT: I guess it's sort of a tank too. Let's battle!

EDIT2: Nevermind. Sorry, it's just so hard!

Edited January 25, 2015 by RAINCRAFTER
Quick tip Raincrafter, try to armor your command pods more. They're an easy target.
I need to get back to building surface units... :/
I need to figure uot the most part efficient way to build boats... :/

Is it just me or does that sound like a threat?
